skill.name: meme-factory
skill.description: Generate memes using the memegen.link API. Use when users request memes, want to add humor to content, or need visual aids for social media. Supports 100+ popular templates with custom text and styling.
skill.summary: Generate contextual memes for conversations, code reviews, social media, and team communication using the free memegen.link API.
skill.author: softaworks

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill contains only documentation with code examples using backticks for markdown formatting, public API URLs for the legitimate memegen.link service, and no actual shell commands or cryptographic operations. The Python helper script uses only standard library URL encoding for meme generation.

high_findings.title: External Commands Pattern (Ruby/shell backtick execution)
high_findings.description: Scanner detected 375 instances of 'backtick execution' in documentation files. These are markdown code block delimiters used for documentation formatting, not actual shell commands. The skill contains no executable Ruby or shell scripts.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backticks are markdown syntax for code blocks used throughout documentation files. No shell or Ruby execution exists in this skill.

high_findings.title: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm (MD5)
high_findings.description: Scanner detected 'weak cryptographic algorithm' patterns in documentation. Investigation reveals these are text references within example URLs and documentation text, not actual cryptographic operations.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: The scanner misidentified text strings in documentation as cryptographic operations. The Python script uses only urllib.parse.quote for URL encoding, not cryptographic functions.

high_findings.title: System Reconnaissance Pattern
high_findings.description: Scanner detected 'system reconnaissance' patterns in documentation. These are example URLs and API endpoint references, not system commands or reconnaissance operations.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: These are documented API endpoints and example URLs for the memegen.link service. No system commands are executed.

medium_findings.title: Hardcoded URLs
medium_findings.description: Scanner detected 62 hardcoded URLs in documentation. These are public API endpoints for memegen.link, the legitimate meme generation service used by this skill.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: These are documented public API endpoints for the legitimate memegen.link service. No credentials or secrets are exposed.

content.value_statement: Users need engaging visual content for conversations, documentation, and social media. This skill generates contextual memes using the free memegen.link API with 100+ templates and custom text styling.
actual_capabilities: Generate memes using 100+ popular templates via memegen.link API
Format text with proper URL encoding for special characters
Create markdown-embedded images for documentation and chat
Suggest appropriate templates based on context (success, failure, comparison, etc.)
Support custom dimensions, layouts, fonts, and background images
Generate contextual memes for code reviews, deployments, and documentation
limitations: Depends on external memegen.link API availability
No built-in image editing or custom template creation
Meme text is limited to two lines (top and bottom)
Requires internet access for meme generation

use_cases.title: Add humor to conversations
use_cases.description: Generate relevant memes to lighten discussions, celebrate wins, or acknowledge challenges in a friendly way.

use_cases.title: Create engaging documentation
use_cases.description: Generate contextual memes for README files, pull requests, and technical documentation to make content more engaging.
use_cases.target_user: Developers, technical writers, open source maintainers

use_cases.title: Social media content
use_cases.description: Create branded or themed memes for social media posts, team communications, and community engagement.
use_cases.target_user: Social media managers, community managers, content creators

prompt_templates.title: Basic meme generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a meme using the {template} template with "{top_text}" on top and "{bottom_text}" at the bottom. Return the markdown image link.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants a specific meme with custom text

prompt_templates.title: Context-based meme
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a meme for this situation: "{situation}". Suggest an appropriate template and generate the meme.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user describes a situation and needs a relevant meme

prompt_templates.title: Code review meme
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a meme for a {outcome} code review where {reason}. Use an appropriate template and include the markdown embed.
prompt_templates.scenario: Responding to code review outcomes with humor

prompt_templates.title: Deployment status meme
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a deployment {status} meme where the deployment {outcome}. Use the success template for successful deploys or the fine template for issues.
prompt_templates.scenario: Sharing deployment status updates with the team

output_examples.input: Generate a meme about testing in production using the interesting template
Create a meme for a successful deployment with zero downtime
Generate a bug vs feature meme using the fry template

best_practices: Keep meme text concise (2-6 words per line for readability)
Match the template to the message context (success, failure, comparison, etc.)
Use proper URL encoding for special characters (underscores for spaces, ~q for ?)
anti_patterns: Using spaces without encoding (URL will break)
Using the wrong template for the context (message loses impact)

faq.question: What templates are available?
faq.answer: The skill supports 100+ templates including buzz, drake, success, fine, fry, changemind, distracted, yodawg, interesting, mordor, and many more.

faq.question: Do I need an API key?
faq.answer: No, memegen.link is a free, open API that does not require authentication or API keys.

faq.question: Can I use custom images?
faq.answer: Yes, you can use any image as a custom background by passing a style URL parameter with the custom image URL.

faq.question: What image formats are supported?
faq.answer: PNG (default, best quality), JPG (smaller file size), WebP (modern compression), and GIF (animated templates).

faq.question: How are special characters handled?
faq.answer: Spaces become underscores, question marks become ~q, slashes become ~s, and other special characters have specific encodings.

faq.question: Can I customize dimensions for different platforms?
faq.answer: Yes, use width and height parameters. Common sizes: 1200x630 for social media, 800x600 for Slack/Discord.
